allEntries.title: GRUNT
allEntries.entry: I'm still not exactly sure about everything GRUNT can do. I had an issue with my .gitignore file that caused me to push up 10,000 files into my repository. This was frustrating but I figured out how to remove them.

allEntries.title: API's (again)
allEntries.entry: Just finished Daily Journal 3, feeling a lot better about working with API's now. Will definitely get more difficult when pulling data in from public API's. Cheers!

allEntries.title: Modularization
allEntries.entry: This morning, I finished up Daily Journal Part 5. The challenge asked us to "clean up" our journal.js file by creating three new js files. I moved the API data handling functions into data.js. I moved the HTML building function into entryComponent.js. I moved the DOM building functions into entriesDOM.js. In each new js file, I declared objects which store all of these functions as methods. This is called modularization. It makes it easier to read code. This was pretty challenging but also very rewarding.

allEntries.title: Working on Daily Journal
allEntries.entry: I have added an edit button to the daily journal entries. This has been quite the task!

allEntries.title: Browserify/Grunt
allEntries.entry: Looks like grunt and browserify are running properly on the project. Just double checking.

allEntries.title: Browserify
allEntries.entry: Today we learned about Browserify and how it relates to modularization. I had to setup grunt on my daily journal project in order to run Browserify. This was difficult to achieve, but it was a great learning experience on how GRUNT works. Then, installing browserify and making sure the file paths were all correct was a learning experience. I was forced to modularize my code again and import/export certain items in order for the program to run. This was actually pretty cool to learn.
